en: For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness, till all the nation, even the men of war that came forth out of Egypt, were consumed, because they hearkened not unto the voice of Jehovah: unto whom Jehovah sware that he would not let them see the land which Jehovah sware unto their fathers that he would give us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
hmr: LALPA râwl an ngai nuom naw leiin mipui po po Aiguptaa inthawka hung suok, râl kap mihai chena, sukbohmanga an um vawng chenin Israel thlahai chu kum sâwmli zet thlalêra chun an invâk a, LALPAIN an thlatuhai kuoma nênetui le khuoi- zua luong ram inkhâma eini mi pêk a lo tiem kha, chu ram chu hmu lo dingin LALPAIN an kuomah ṭawng ân khâm a nih.

en: And their children, whom he raised up in their stead, them did Joshua circumcise: for they were uncircumcised, because they had not circumcised them by the way.
hmr: Chuongchun, an thlahai anni aia ân ngîrhai chu Josua chun an ser a tanpêk a, lam kâra khan an ser tan a ni naw leiin, sertanlo an lo ni zing sih a,

en: And it came to pass, when they had done circumcising all the nation, that they abode in their places in the camp, till they were whole.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai po po ser an tan zo chun an dam hmakhat chu an riebûk mâni hmun sengah an um a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Joshua, This day have I rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you. Wherefore the name of that place was called Gilgal, unto this day.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Josua kuomah, “Vawisûn hin Aigupta mihai hmusit- na cheu hi kân hlum hmang tah,” a ta. Chuongchun, chu hmun chu tu chen hin Gilgal an lo ti a nih.

en: And the children of Israel encamped in Gilgal; and they kept the passover on the fourteenth day of the month at even in the plains of Jericho.
hmr: Israel thlahai chun Gilgala chun umhmun an khuor a; chun, Jeriko phaiahai chun chu thla ni sâwmpali ni, zântieng chun Fêkân Ruoiṭhe an hmang tah a.

en: And they did eat of the produce of the land on the morrow after the passover, unleavened cakes and parched grain, in the selfsame day.
hmr: Fêkân Ruoiṭhe zo tûk ni ngei chun chu rama bu chawl ṭhanglo bei le bu zêupuok an fâk a.

en: And the manna ceased on the morrow, after they had eaten of the produce of the land; neither had the children of Israel manna any more; but they did eat of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year.
hmr: Chu rama bu an fâk zînga inthawk chun manna kha a tla ta nawh a; Israel thlahai chun manna chu an dawng ta ngai bawk nawh, chu kum chun Kanaan rama bu le bâl chu an fâk ta lem a nih.

en: And it came to pass, when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted up his eyes and looked, and, behold, there stood a man over against him with his sword drawn in his hand: and Joshua went unto him, and said unto him, Art thou for us, or for our adversaries?
hmr: Chun, Josua chu Jeriko khaw bula a la um lai chun a dâk a, a hang en a; a hma zâwn ela chun mi pakhat a kâwlhnâm phawisa chawia lo ngîr zing hi a hmuh a. Josua chun a hang pan a, a kuoma chun, “Keini tienga ṭhang am i ni, kan hmêlmahai tieng?” a ta.

en: And he said, Nay; but as prince of the host of Jehovah am I now come. And Joshua fell on his face to the earth, and did worship, and said unto him, What saith my lord unto his servant?
hmr: Ama chun, “Ni lo e, LALPA sipaihai hotu dinga hung ka ni lem,” a tih a. Chuongchun, Josua chu hnuoiah a bawkkhup a, chibai a bûk a, a kuom- ah, “Ka Lalpa chun a siehlaw kuoma hin ieng am hril ding a nei a?” a ta.

en: And the prince of Jehovah’s host said unto Joshua, Put off thy shoe from off thy foot; for the place whereon thou standest is holy. And Joshua did so.
hmr: Chun LALPA sipaihai hotu chun Josua kuomah, “I kephaa in- thawkin i kekawk kha hlîp rawh, i ngîrna hmun kha ân thieng a nih ie,” a tih a. Chuongchun, Josua chun chuong ang chun a thaw tah a.

en: Now Jericho was straitly shut up because of the children of Israel: none went out, and none came in.
hmr: Jeriko khuo chu Israel thlahai lei chun an khâr tlat a, tukhawm an suok nawh a, tukhawm an lût bawk nawh.

en: And Jehovah said unto Joshua, See, I have given into thy hand Jericho, and the king thereof, and the mighty men of valor.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Josua kuomah, “En ta, Jeriko le a lal le mi hrât huoisenhai hi i kutah ka pêk tah.

en: And ye shall compass the city, all the men of war, going about the city once. Thus shalt thou do six days.
hmr: Râl kâp mi po po hin khawpui hi vêlin vawikhat chu hang vêl suok phawt in ta; chuong ang ruok chun ni ruk in thaw ding a nih.

en: And seven priests shall bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark: and the seventh day ye shall compass the city seven times, and the priests shall blow the trumpets.
hmr: Chun, thiempu pasariin bâwm hma tieng berâmchal ki tawtawrâwt pasari chawi an ta; chun, a ni sari ni chun khawpui chu vawi sari vêl suok in ta, chun, thiempuhai chun taw- tawrâwthai chu mût an tih.

en: And it shall be, that, when they make a long blast with the ram’s horn, and when ye hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people shall shout with a great shout; and the wall of the city shall fall down flat, and the people shall go up every man straight before him.
hmr: Chun, berâmchal ki an mût rik ruoi ruoi a, tawtawrâwt ri in hriet pha chun, mipui po po chu inring- takin khêk dur dur raw se; chuong- chun, khawpui kul chu chim rup a ta, mipui chu mâni hma zâwn sengah chun hang fêng an tih,” a ta.

en: And Joshua the son of Nun called the priests, and said unto them, Take up the ark of the covenant, and let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Nun naupa Josua chun thiempuhai chu a ko a, an kuomah, “Thuthlung bâwm hi zâwn unla, thiempu pasariin LALPA bâwm hmatienga chun berâmchal ki taw- tawrâwt pasari chawi raw se,” a ta.

en: And they said unto the people, Pass on, and compass the city, and let the armed men pass on before the ark of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, ama chun mipuihai kuoma chun, “Fe pei unla, khawpui chu vêl suok ro, chun, inrâlthuomhai kha LAL- PA bâwm hmatieng fe pei raw se,” a ta.

en: And it was so, that, when Joshua had spoken unto the people, the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams’ horns before Jehovah passed on, and blew the trumpets: and the ark of the covenant of Jehovah followed them.
hmr: Josuain mipuihai kuoma thu a hril zo chun LALPA hmaa berâmchal ki tawtawrâwt pasari chawi thiempu pasarihai chu an fe pei a, tawtawrâwt chu an mût a; chun, LALPA thu- thlung bâwm chun a zui a.

en: And the armed men went before the priests that blew the trumpets, and the rearward went after the ark, the priests blowing the trumpets as they went.
hmr: Chun, inrâlthuomhai chu taw- tawrâwt mûttu thiempuhai hmaa chun an feh a, chun a hnungdâlhai chun bâwm chu an sawm a, thiem- puhai chun fe malamin tawtawrâwt chu an mût pei a.

en: And Joshua commanded the people, saying, Ye shall not shout, nor let your voice be heard, neither shall any word proceed out of your mouth, until the day I bid you shout; then shall ye shout.
hmr: Chun, Josua chun mipuihai chu, “Khêk dêr naw unla, in râwl khawm hriet ni naw raw se, khêk dinga thu ka pêk ni cheu a tlung hmakhat chu in bâua inthawkin thu hrim hrim suok bawk naw sien, chu pha ruok chun chu khêk ro,” tiin thu a pêk a.

en: So he caused the ark of Jehovah to compass the city, going about it once: and they came into the camp, and lodged in the camp.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA bâwm chun khawpui chu vêl khat ân vêl suoktir a; chun, riebûka chun an feh a, riebûka chun an riek tah a.

en: And Joshua rose early in the morning, and the priests took up the ark of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Josua chu zingkâr in- hmatakin a tho a, thiempuhai chun LALPA bâwm chu an zâwn a.

en: And the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of Jehovah went on continually, and blew the trumpets: and the armed men went before them; and the rearward came after the ark of Jehovah, the priests blowing the trumpets as they went.
hmr: Chun, LALPA bâwm hmaa be- râmchal ki tawtawrâwt pasari chawi thiempu pasarihai kha an fe pei a; tawtawrâwt an mût a; chun, inrâl- thuomhai chu an hmaah an feh a; chun, a hnungdâlhai chun LALPA bâwm chu an sawm a, thiempuhai chun, fe malamin tawtawrâwt an mût pei a.

en: And the second day they compassed the city once, and returned into the camp: so they did six days.
hmr: Chun, a ni hni ni chun khawpui chu vawi khat an hang vêl suok nâwk a, riebûka chun an kîr nâwk a; chuong ang ruok chun ni ruk an thawh a.

en: And it came to pass on the seventh day, that they rose early at the dawning of the day, and compassed the city after the same manner seven times: only on that day they compassed the city seven times.
hmr: A ni sari ni chun zîngkâr vâr- ṭienin an tho a, thaw dân pângngaiin vawi sari an vêl suok a, chu ni chau chun khawpui chu vawi sari an vêl suok a nih.

en: And it came to pass at the seventh time, when the priests blew the trumpets, Joshua said unto the people, Shout; for Jehovah hath given you the city.
hmr: A vawi sarinaa thiempuhaiin tawtawrâwt an hang mût chun Josua chun mipuihai kuoma chun, “Khêk ro khai, LALPAIN khawpui hi a pêk ta cheu a nih.

en: And the city shall be devoted, even it and all that is therein, to Jehovah: only Rahab the harlot shall live, she and all that are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers that we sent.
hmr: Khawpui hi a sûnga thil um po po pumin suksiet dinga LALPA kuoma pumpêk vawng ding a nih; Rahab nawchizawr chau, ama le a in sûnga ama le um po pohai ruok chu ei mi tirhai kha a lo thuphmang leiin hla ding a nih.

en: But as for you, only keep yourselves from the devoted thing, lest when ye have devoted it, ye take of the devoted thing; so would ye make the camp of Israel accursed, and trouble it.
hmr: Nangni ruokchu suksiet dinga thil pumpêka inthawk chun insie- kieng hlau ro, chuong naw chun, suksiet dinga thil pumpêk laia mi ieng khawm lo lain, Israelhai riebûk hi suksiet dingah siem in ta, lunginzîngna intlun hlau rawi in tih.

en: But all the silver, and gold, and vessels of brass and iron, are holy unto Jehovah: they shall come into the treasury of Jehovah.
hmr: Tangkaruo dâm, rângkachak dâm, dâr le thîr bûrlebêlhai ruok chu a rêngin LALPA kuoma inthieng a na, LALPA sum inah an lût vawng ding a nih,” a ta.

en: So the people shouted, and the priests blew the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, that the people shouted with a great shout, and the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipuihai chu an khêk a, tawtawrâwthai mût an nih a. Tawtawrâwt ri an hang hriet phingleh, an khêk ta dur dur a, kul chu a chim hmât vawng a; chuong- chun, mi tin chu mâni hma zawn senga chun an feh a, khawpuia chun an lût a, khawpui chu an lâk tah a.

en: And they utterly destroyed all that was in the city, both man and woman, both young and old, and ox, and sheep, and ass, with the edge of the sword.
hmr: Khawpui sûnga mi po po nuhmei pasal, a chîn a lien, bâwng- chal dâm, sabengtung dâm leh kâwl- hnâmin an sât hlum vawng tah a.

en: And Joshua said unto the two men that had spied out the land, Go into the harlot’s house, and bring out thence the woman, and all that she hath, as ye sware unto her.
hmr: Chun, Josua chun mi pahni ram va enthlatuhai kuoma chun, “Nâw- chizawr ina chun va lût unla, a kuoma ṭawng in lo inkhâm ta ang khan chu nuhmei chu a nei po po leh va ṭhuoi suok ro,” a ta.

en: And the young men the spies went in, and brought out Rahab, and her father, and her mother, and her brethren, and all that she had; all her kindred also they brought out; and they set them without the camp of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, enthlatu tlang- vâlhai chu an va lût a, Rahab le a pa le a nu leh, a unaupahai leh, a nei po pohai le chun an va ṭhuoi suok a, a laibung unauhai po po khawm an va ṭhuoi suok a, Israelhai riebûk puo- tienga chun an inumtir a.

en: And they burnt the city with fire, and all that was therein; only the silver, and the gold, and the vessels of brass and of iron, they put into the treasury of the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, khawpui chu a sûnga thil um po po leh meiin an raw vawng a, tangkaruo dâm, rângkachak dâm, dâr le thîr bûr le bêlhai chau chu LALPA in sum inah an sieh a.

en: But Rahab the harlot, and her father’s household, and all that she had, did Joshua save alive; and she dwelt in the midst of Israel unto this day, because she hid the messengers, whom Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Rahab nawchi- zawr le a nei po po le a pa sûnghai chu Josua chun a hla vawng a; chuong- chun, Israelhai lai chun tu chen hin a la ṭhang ta zing a nih, Josuain Jeriko khuo enthla dinga a tirhai kha a lo thuphmang leiin.

en: And Joshua charged them with an oath at that time, saying, Cursed be the man before Jehovah, that riseth up and buildeth this city Jericho: with the loss of his first-born shall he lay the foundation thereof, and with the loss of his youngest son shall he set up the gates of it.
hmr: Chuong lai chun Josua chun, “Hi Jeriko khuo hi hung indina hung bâwl taphawt chu LALPA hmaa chun ṭawngsephurin um raw se, a nau lutîr chu chânin a lungphûm chu phûm a ta, a nau mitlum chânin a kul kawtkhârhai chu indin a tih,” tiin anni chu a vau a.

en: So Jehovah was with Joshua; and his fame was in all the land.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chu Josua kuoma chun a um a, a ram pumpuia chun a hming a hung inthang tah a.

en: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the devoted thing; for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the devoted thing: and the anger of Jehovah was kindled against the children of Israel.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Israel thlahai chun thil pumpêk chun thil an lo suksuol tah a. Juda hnama mi Zera naupa Zabdi, chu naupa Karmi, chu naupa Akan chun thil pumpêka mi chu a lo lâk a; chuongchun, Israel thlahai chunga chun LALPA lung a lo sen tah a.

en: And Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Beth-aven, on the east side of Beth-el, and spake unto them, saying, Go up and spy out the land. And the men went up and spied out Ai.
hmr: Chun, Josua chun Jeriko khuoa inthawk chun Bethel saktieng, Beth-Aven dep Ai khuoa chun mihai a tir a, an kuomah, “Hang fe unla, ram hang enthla ta u,” tiin a hril a. Mihai chu an hang feh a, Ai khuo chu an hang enthlâk tah a.

en: And they returned to Joshua, and said unto him, Let not all the people go up; but let about two or three thousand men go up and smite Ai; make not all the people to toil thither; for they are but few.
hmr: Chun, Josua kuoma chun an kir nâwk a, a kuomah, “Mi po po chu hang fe kher da el raw hai se, mi sâng hni amanih, sâng thum amanih hang fe hai sienla, Ai khuo chu thaw raw se; mi po po hang suksâwl kher ding a ni nawh ie, tlâwmte chau an ni sih a,” an ta.

en: So there went up thither of the people about three thousand men: and they fled before the men of Ai.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui laia mi chu mi sâng thum vêl chutaka chun an hang feh a; chun, Ai mihai hmaa chun an hung tlânse tah a.

en: And the men of Ai smote of them about thirty and six men; and they chased them from before the gate even unto Shebarim, and smote them at the descent: and the hearts of the people melted, and became as water.
hmr: Ai mihai chun mi sâwmthum le paruk lai an lo that a, dai kawtkhâr bula inthawk Sebarim chen rauin an hung hnawt a, an liem thlâknaa chun an that tâwl a, chun, mihai lungril chu ân tui zo tah a, tui ang el a lo ni tah a.

en: And Joshua rent his clothes, and fell to the earth upon his face before the ark of Jehovah until the evening, he and the elders of Israel; and they put dust upon their heads.
hmr: Josua chun a puonhai a keithlêr a, ama le Israel upahai chu LALPA bâwm hmaa chun an hmaia hnuoi sikin zântieng chenin an bawkkhup a; an luah pilvut an inphul a.

en: And Joshua said, Alas, O Lord Jehovah, wherefore hast thou at all brought this people over the Jordan, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to cause us to perish? would that we had been content and dwelt beyond the Jordan!
hmr: Josua chun, “E khai, iengdinga, Aw Lalpa PATHIEN, keini mipuihai hi sukbohmanga um dinga Amor mihai kuta pêk dinga Jordan vadung hi mi ṭhuoi kai am i na? Jordan vadung râla khan lungawitaka um ṭawk ṭawk ta lem ding kha aw.

en: Oh, Lord, what shall I say, after that Israel hath turned their backs before their enemies!
hmr: Aw Lalpa, hienga hmêlmahai hnawta Israelhai an tlânse el hi ieng tin am ka thaw ding a ni ta leh?

en: For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear of it, and will compass us round, and cut off our name from the earth: and what wilt thou do for thy great name?
hmr: Kanaan mihai le hieng laia chênghai po po hin hrieng an ta, mi hung inhuol an ta, hnuoi chunga inthawk hin kan hming an sukbo dai ding a ni hi; i hming ropuitak ta ding hin ieng am i thaw ding a ni ta leh?” a ta.

en: And Jehovah said unto Joshua, Get thee up; wherefore art thou thus fallen upon thy face?
hmr: LALPA chun Josua kuomah, “Tho rawh, iengdinga khânga i bawkkhup zing am a na?

en: Israel hath sinned; yea, they have even transgressed my covenant which I commanded them: yea, they have even taken of the devoted thing, and have also stolen, and dissembled also; and they have even put it among their own stuff.
hmr: Israelhai hin thil an suksuol a nih; ka thuthlung pawm dinga ka pêk kha an bawsiet a ni hi; thil pumpêk laia ṭhenkhat an lâk bawk a nih; an inrûk a, an ip bawk a, an thuomhnaw lai ngei an thuphmang a nih.

en: Therefore the children of Israel cannot stand before their enemies; they turn their backs before their enemies, because they are become accursed: I will not be with you any more, except ye destroy the devoted thing from among you.
hmr: Chuleichun, a nih annâwm Israel thlahaiin an hmêlmahai an ngam thei naw; mawchang an lo ni ta leiin annâwm an hmêlmahai an hnung innghat el chu; thil pumpêk chu in laia in sukbo phawt naw chun in kuoma hin ka um ta naw ding a nih.

en: Up, sanctify the people, and say, Sanctify yourselves against to-morrow: for thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, There is a devoted thing in the midst of thee, O Israel; thou canst not stand before thine enemies, until ye take away the devoted thing from among you.
hmr: Tho la, mipuihai hi hlânthieng phawt el rawh; chun, an kuomah, ‘Zînga dingin inhlânthieng ro khai, LALPA Israelhai Pathien chun, “Aw Israelhai, nangni lai hin thil pumpêk a um a nih, nangni laia thil pumpêk hi in lâk hmang hmakhat chun in hmêlmahai hi hne thei naw ti niu,” a ti a nih.

en: In the morning therefore ye shall be brought near by your tribes: and it shall be, that the tribe which Jehovah taketh shall come near by families; and the family which Jehovah shall take shall come near by households; and the household which Jehovah shall take shall come near man by man.
hmr: Chuongchun, zîngkâr a chi chia hung inlang ding in nih; LALPAIN chu mi chi a lo man chu a hnam hnamin in hung inlang nâwk ding a nih; chun, LALPAIN chu hnam a lo man chu a sûng sûngin in hung inlang nâwk ding a nih; chun, LALPAIN chu sûng a lo man chu a khât khâtin in hung inlang nâwk ding a nih.

en: And it shall be, that he that is taken with the devoted thing shall be burnt with fire, he and all that he hath; because he hath transgressed the covenant of Jehovah, and because he hath wrought folly in Israel.
hmr: Chun, tukhawm thil pumpêk lo la ta chu ama le a thil nei po po leh meia raw vawng ding a nih; LALPA thuthlung a bawsiet lei le, Israelhai lai thil suol invêtthlâktak a thaw leiin,’ ti rawh” a ta.

en: So Joshua rose up early in the morning, and brought Israel near by their tribes; and the tribe of Judah was taken:
hmr: Chun, Josua chu zîngkâr inhmatakin a tho a, Israelhai chu a chi chiin a hung inlang tir a; Juda chihai chu man an lo ni tah a.

en: and he brought near the family of Judah; and he took the family of the Zerahites: and he brought near the family of the Zerahites man by man; and Zabdi was taken:
hmr: Juda hnamhai chu a hung inlangtir nâwk a; Zer hnamhai chu a lo man a, Zerhai sûnghai chu a khât khâtin a hung inlangtir nâwk a; Zabdi chu man a lo ni tah a.

en: and he brought near his household man by man; and Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken.
hmr: Zabdi sûnghai chu a khât khâtin a hung inlangtir nâwk a; chuongchun, Juda chia mi Zera naupa, Zabdi, chu naupa Karmi,

en: And Joshua said unto Achan, My son, give, I pray thee, glory to Jehovah, the God of Israel, and make confession unto him; and tell me now what thou hast done; hide it not from me.
hmr: chu naupa Akan chu man a lo ni tah a. Josua chun Akan kuoma chun, “Ka naupa, LALPA Israelhai Pathien chu ropuina pe rawh, a kuoma chun inphuong raw khai; i thilthaw chu mi hang hril ta, ka kuoma chu ip naw raw khai,” a ta.

en: And Achan answered Joshua, and said, Of a truth I have sinned against Jehovah, the God of Israel, and thus and thus have I done:
hmr: Akan chun Josua chu a dawn a, a kuomah, “LALPA Israelhai Pathien chunga chun thil ka lo suksuol ta ngei el, hieng ang hin a nih ka lo thaw chu:

en: when I saw among the spoil a goodly Babylonish mantle, and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight, then I coveted them, and took them; and, behold, they are hid in the earth in the midst of my tent, and the silver under it.
hmr: râllâk laia mi Babulon ram puon ṭhatak le, tangka shekel za hni le, rângkachak tlang shekel sâwmnga bûk ka hmuh a, kân hnar êm a, ka lâk el a nih; chun, ngai ta, ka puon in sûngah hnuoiah thuphmang a na, tangka chu chu hnuoia chun a um,” a tih a.

en: So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran unto the tent; and, behold, it was hid in his tent, and the silver under it.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josua chun mihai a tir a, puon in sûnga chun an va tlân a; chun, puon ina chun thuphmang a lo ni a, hnuoia chun tangka khawm chu a um ngei ti an hmuh a.

en: And they took them from the midst of the tent, and brought them unto Joshua, and unto all the children of Israel; and they laid them down before Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, puon in sûnga inthawk chun an lâk a, Josua le Israel thlahai po po kuoma chun an hung chawi a; LALPA hmaa chun an sie tah a.

en: And Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan the son of Zerah, and the silver, and the mantle, and the wedge of gold, and his sons, and his daughters, and his oxen, and his asses, and his sheep, and his tent, and all that he had: and they brought them up unto the valley of Achor.
hmr: Chun, Josua le Israelhai po po chun, Zera naupa Akan chu tangka dâm, puon dâm, rângkachak tlang dâm, a naupahai dâm, a naunuhai dâm, a bâwngchalhai dâm, a sabeng- tunghai dâm, a berâmhai le a puon in dâm le a neihai po po le chun an ṭhuoi a, Akor ruomah an hang fepui a.

en: And Joshua said, Why hast thou troubled us? Jehovah shall trouble thee this day. And all Israel stoned him with stones; and they burned them with fire, and stoned them with stones.
hmr: Chun, Josua chun, “Iengdinga i mi suklungzîng am a na? LALPA chun nang khawm vawisûn hin a suklungzîng ve ding che a ni hi,” a ta. Chuongchun, Israelhai po po chun ama chu lungin an dêng a; chun, ama chu meiin an rawh a, lungin an dêng bawk a.

en: And they raised over him a great heap of stones, unto this day; and Jehovah turned from the fierceness of his anger. Wherefore the name of that place was called, The valley of Achor, unto this day.
hmr: A chunga chun lung an intieng vûm thûr a, tu chen hin a la um a; chun, LALPA lunginsenna nasatak chu a re tah a; chuongchun, chu hmun hminga chun tu chen hin Akor ruom an la ti zing a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Joshua, Fear not, neither be thou dismayed: take all the people of war with thee, and arise, go up to Ai; see, I have given into thy hand the king of Ai, and his people, and his city, and his land;
hmr: LALPA chun Josua kuomah, “Ṭi naw la, zâm bawk naw rawh, râlkâp mi po po i kuomah ṭhuoi la, tho la, Ai khuoah hang fe rawh; ngai ta, Ai khaw lal le, a mihai le, a khuo le a ram chu i kutah ka pêk tah.

en: and thou shalt do to Ai and her king as thou didst unto Jericho and her king: only the spoil thereof, and the cattle thereof, shall ye take for a prey unto yourselves: set thee an ambush for the city behind it.
hmr: Jeriko le an lal chunga i thaw ang khan Ai khuo le a lal chunga khawm thâwng i ta, râllâk le ranhai chau chu nangni chan dingin lâng in tih. Khawpui inchânru ding a hnung tiengah sie bawk rawh,” a tih a.

en: So Joshua arose, and all the people of war, to go up to Ai: and Joshua chose out thirty thousand men, the mighty men of valor, and sent them forth by night.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josua le râl kâp mi po po chu Ai khuo tienga hang fe ding chun an inthawk tah a; Josua chun mi hrât huoisen sîng thum a thlang suok a, zânah ân fetir a.

en: And he commanded them, saying, Behold, ye shall lie in ambush against the city, behind the city; go not very far from the city, but be ye all ready:
hmr: Anni chu thu a pêk a, “Ngai ta u, khawpui hnungtienga chun khawpui chu thaw dingin inchânru unla, khawpuia inthawka hlatakah fe naw unla, inzosa zingin um phawt el ro.

en: and I, and all the people that are with me, will approach unto the city. And it shall come to pass, when they come out against us, as at the first, that we will flee before them;
hmr: Kei le keia kuoma umhai po po chun khawpui chu hung hnai kan ta; inhma ang bawka eini mi thaw dinga an hung suok phaleh, an hmaah tlânsieng kan ta.

en: and they will come out after us, till we have drawn them away from the city; for they will say, They flee before us, as at the first: so we will flee before them;
hmr: Chuongchun, mi hung hnawt dingin hung suok an ta, khuoa inthawka hla rei chen kan zâwr suok chenin; anni chun, ‘Inhma ang bawk khan ei hmaah an tlansie nâwk tah,’ an ti ding a nih. Chuongchun, an hmaah tlânsieng kan tih.

en: and ye shall rise up from the ambush, and take possession of the city: for Jehovah your God will deliver it into your hand.
hmr: Chun, inchânrûknaa inthawk chun hung suok in ta, khawpui chu la el in tih; LALPA in Pathienin in kutah a pêk ding a nih.

en: And it shall be, when ye have seized upon the city, that ye shall set the city on fire; according to the word of Jehovah shall ye do: see, I have commanded you.
hmr: Khawpui chu in lâk phingleh, khawpui chu raw el ro, LALPA thu ang peiin in thaw ding a nih; ngai ta u, thu ka pêk ta cheu hi,” tiin.

en: And Joshua sent them forth; and they went to the ambushment, and abode between Beth-el and Ai, on the west side of Ai: but Joshua lodged that night among the people.
hmr: Chun, Josua chun ân fetir tah a, inchânrûkna hmuna chun an feh a. Ai khuo thlangtienga Bethel le Ai khuo inkâra chun an um a, Josua ruok chu, chu zân chun mipuihai lai a riek a.

en: And Joshua arose up early in the morning, and mustered the people, and went up, he and the elders of Israel, before the people to Ai.
hmr: Chun, Josua chu zîngkâr in- hmatakin a tho a, mipuihai chu a kei khâwm a; chun, ama le Israel upahai chu mipuihai hmaa chun Ai khuo tieng an hang feh a.

en: And all the people, even the men of war that were with him, went up, and drew nigh, and came before the city, and encamped on the north side of Ai: now there was a valley between him and Ai.
hmr: A kuoma râl kâp mi umhai po po chu an hang feh a, khawpui bul chen chu an hang feh a, Ai khuo hmârtieng panga chun an riek a; Ai khuo le an inkâra chun ruom a um a.

en: And he took about five thousand men, and set them in ambush between Beth-el and Ai, on the west side of the city.
hmr: Chun, mi sâng nga lai a ṭhuoi a, khawpui thlangtieng pang Bethel le Ai khuo inkâra chun ân chânrûktir a.

en: So they set the people, even all the host that was on the north of the city, and their liers-in-wait that were on the west of the city; and Joshua went that night into the midst of the valley.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui khawpui hmârtieng panga sipaihai ṭhang- hmun le, khawpui thlangtieng panga inchânrutuhai ṭhanghmun chu an hang ruot fel a; Josua chu chu zân chun ruom laitaka chun a riek a.

en: And it came to pass, when the king of Ai saw it, that they hasted and rose up early, and the men of the city went out against Israel to battle, he and all his people, at the time appointed, before the Arabah; but he knew not that there was an ambush against him behind the city.
hmr: Chun, Ai khuo lal chun chu chu a hmu phingleh, inhmâwtakin chu tûk chun, chu khuoa mihai, ama le a rawihai po po chu an tho a, a hmun ruot Araba zâwnah Israelhai chu thaw dingin an hung suok tah a; nisienlakhawm, khuo hnungtieng chun ama thaw dingin an inchânrûk ti a hriet nawh a.

en: And Joshua and all Israel made as if they were beaten before them, and fled by the way of the wilderness.
hmr: Josua le Israel mihai po po chu tlâwm ni âwmtakin an um a, thlalêr tienga lampuia chun an tlân tah a.

en: And all the people that were in the city were called together to pursue after them: and they pursued after Joshua, and were drawn away from the city.
hmr: Chun, khawpuia mi umhai po po chu anni hnawt dingin an ko khâwm a, chuongchun, Josua chu an hnawt a, khawpuia inthawk chun hla rei chu zâwr suokin an um tah a.

en: And there was not a man left in Ai or Beth-el, that went not out after Israel: and they left the city open, and pursued after Israel.
hmr: Ai khuo le Bethel khuoa chun Israelhai hnawt lo chu pakhat bek khawm an um ta nawh a; khawpui chu khâr loin an mâksan el tah a, Israelhai chu an hnawt tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Joshua, Stretch out the javelin that is in thy hand toward Ai; for I will give it into thy hand. And Joshua stretched out the javelin that was in his hand toward the city.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Josua kuom- ah, “Fei i kuta um kha Ai khuo tieng nghain inlet rawh, i kutah ka pêk ding a nih,” a ta. Chuongchun, Josua chun a kuta fei chu khawpui tieng ngha chun a hang inlet tah a.

en: And the ambush arose quickly out of their place, and they ran as soon as he had stretched out his hand, and entered into the city, and took it; and they hasted and set the city on fire.
hmr: Chun, ân chânrutuhai kha an umna hmuna inthawk chun an hung suok vat a; a kut chu a hang phar phingleh an tlân a, khawpuia chun an lût a, an lâk tah a; khuo chu an raw tah a.

en: And when the men of Ai looked behind them, they saw, and, behold, the smoke of the city ascended up to heaven, and they had no power to flee this way or that way: and the people that fled to the wilderness turned back upon the pursuers.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ai mihai chun an hnungtieng an hei thlîr chun, khaw- pui khu vântienga tung ngut ngut el chu an hmu tah a, khawtieng tienga khawm tlân theina hrim hrim an nei ta nawh a; chuongchun, thlalêra tlânhai khan anni hnawttuhai chu an hung lenghat ve ta thung a.

en: And when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city, and that the smoke of the city ascended, then they turned again, and slew the men of Ai.
hmr: Chun, Josua le Israelhai po po chun inchânrutuhaiin khawpui an lâk, khawpui khu chu ân tung ngut ngut an hei hmu chun an hung kîr a, Ai mihai chu an that tah a.

en: And the others came forth out of the city against them; so they were in the midst of Israel, some on this side, and some on that side: and they smote them, so that they let none of them remain or escape.
hmr: Chun, mi danghai chu a thaw dingin khaw sûnga inthawk chun an hung suok a; chuongchun, Israelhai chun ruongchaiche an thlâk tah a; a ṭhen khingtieng an um a, a ṭhen khingtieng an um bawk a; chuong- chun, an that a, pakhat khawm hla le insuo hrim hrim an nei nawh a.

en: And the king of Ai they took alive, and brought him to Joshua.
hmr: Ai khuo lal ruok chu a hringin an man a, Josua kuomah an ṭhuoi a.

en: And it came to pass, when Israel had made an end of slaying all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness wherein they pursued them, and they were all fallen by the edge of the sword, until they were consumed, that all Israel returned unto Ai, and smote it with the edge of the sword.
hmr: Israel mihai chun Ai khuoa mi phûla umhai po po chu thlalêr rama anni an va hnawtna hmunah an that zo a, an rênga kâwlhnâma an that rêm dêr hnung chun, Israel mihai po po chu Ai khuo tieng chun an kîr nâwk a, kâwlhnâmin an that tah a.

en: And all that fell that day, both of men and women, were twelve thousand, even all the men of Ai.
hmr: Chu nia thihai po po chu nuhmei le pasal mi sîng khat le sâng hni an nih, Ai khuoa mihai po po chu.

en: For Joshua drew not back his hand, wherewith he stretched out the javelin, until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
hmr: Josua chun a fei inletna kut chu Ai mihai po po a sukbohmang vawng hmakhat chun a kei thlâk nawh a.

en: Only the cattle and the spoil of that city Israel took for prey unto themselves, according unto the word of Jehovah which he commanded Joshua.
hmr: LALPAIN Josua thu a pêk a, thaw ding a ti ang ngei khan chu khawpuia ranhai le râllâkhai chau chu Israelhai chun anni chanpuolah an nei a.

en: So Joshua burnt Ai, and made it a heap for ever, even a desolation, unto this day.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josua chun Ai khuo chu a rawh a, kumkhuoa dingin hnuoi pâwngah a siem a, tu chen hin râusan a lo ni tah a nih.

en: And the king of Ai he hanged on a tree until the eventide: and at the going down of the sun Joshua commanded, and they took his body down from the tree, and cast it at the entrance of the gate of the city, and raised thereon a great heap of stones, unto this day.
hmr: Chun, Ai khuo lal chu zântieng chenin thinglêrah a khai a; nisa tlâka chun Josuain thu a pêk a; chuong- chun, a ruong chu thinglêra inthawk chun an lâk thlâk a, khawpui dâi kawtkhâr lûtnaah an pei a, a chungah lung an dêng vûm thûr a, chu chu tu chen hin a la um.

en: Then Joshua built an altar unto Jehovah, the God of Israel, in mount Ebal,
hmr: Josua chun Ebal tlângah LALPA, Israelhai Pathien ta dingin mâichâm a siem a;

en: as Moses the servant of Jehovah commanded the children of Israel, as it is written in the book of the law of Moses, an altar of unhewn stones, upon which no man had lifted up any iron: and they offered thereon burnt-offerings unto Jehovah, and sacrificed peace-offerings.
hmr: Mosie dân lekhabua ziek ta anga, LALPA siehlaw Mosien Israel thlahai chu a lo pêk ta ang khan; chu mâichâm chu lung sut lo, tukhawma a chunga thîr an lân let ngailo a na; chutaka chun LALPA ta dingin pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai an in- hlân a, inremna thilinhlânhaiin an inthâwi a.

en: And he wrote there upon the stones a copy of the law of Moses, which he wrote, in the presence of the children of Israel.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun Israel thlahai hma ngeia Mosien dân a ziek kha lungahai chun a zieksâwng a,

en: And all Israel, and their elders and officers, and their judges, stood on this side of the ark and on that side before the priests the Levites, that bare the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, as well the sojourner as the home-born; half of them in front of mount Gerizim, and half of them in front of mount Ebal; as Moses the servant of Jehovah had commanded at the first, that they should bless the people of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai po po, an upa- hai le hotuhai, an rorêltuhai leh, Levi chi thiempuhai, LALPA thuthlungna bâwm zâwntuhai hmaah, bâwm khingtieng khingtieng panga chun hnam danghai le, chu rama pienghai khawm chu an ngîr hmunkhat seng a. A zâtve chu Gerizim tlâng pangah an um a, a zâtve chu Ebal tlâng pangah an um a, LALPA siehlaw Mosiein Israelhai chu mal a sâwmpêk ding a nih tia thu a lo pêk tah ang khan.

en: And afterward he read all the words of the law, the blessing and the curse, according to all that is written in the book of the law.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun dân thu po po, malsâwmna thu le ṭawngse- phurna thu chu a tiem a, dân lekha- bua chuong ang po po el kha.

en: There was not a word of all that Moses commanded, which Joshua read not before all the assembly of Israel, and the women, and the little ones, and the sojourners that were among them.
hmr: Mosie thupêk ang po po chu Israel pungkhâwm po pohai le nu- hmeihai le naupang chite tehai le anni laia hnam dang chêng vehai hrieta chun Josua chun tiem ṭhel hrim hrim a nei nawh.

en: And it came to pass, when all the kings that were beyond the Jordan, in the hill-country, and in the lowland, and on all the shore of the great sea in front of Lebanon, the Hittite, and the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, heard thereof;
hmr: Chun, Jordan vadung râla lalhai po po tlânga mi le phaia mi dâm, tuisuoriet lientak vatluona Lebanon chena um po po Hit mihai, Amor mihai, Kanaan mihai, Periz mihai, Hiv mihai, Jebus mihai chun an lo hriet chun,

en: that they gathered themselves together, to fight with Joshua and with Israel, with one accord.
hmr: Josua le Israelhai chu inthuruola thawhrawn tumin an pungkhâwm tah a.

en: But when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done unto Jericho and to Ai,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Gibeon khuoa umhai chun Josuain Jeriko khuo le Ai khuo a thaw dân an lo hriet chun,

en: they also did work wilily, and went and made as if they had been ambassadors, and took old sacks upon their asses, and wine-skins, old and rent and bound up,
hmr: var vervêkin an châng ve ta thung a, palai angin an insiem a, ip hluitak tak an sabengtunghai an inphurtir a, uoin peng hluitak tak, a ṭiek tahai leh,

en: and old and patched shoes upon their feet, and old garments upon them; and all the bread of their provision was dry and was become mouldy.
hmr: kekawk hluitak tak, inphâwk ṭêt ṭût hi an bun a, puon hluitak tak an sil a, an fâk dinga an hung chawi beihai chu ṭâwl ṭekṭuk le ap bur el dâm hi a na.

en: And they went to Joshua unto the camp at Gilgal, and said unto him, and to the men of Israel, We are come from a far country: now therefore make ye a covenant with us.
hmr: Chun, Josua kuomah Gilgala an riebûka chun an va feh a, a kuoma le Israelhai kuoma chun, “Ram hlataka inthawka hung kan na; chuongchun, kan kuoma hin thu thlung ro khai,” an va tih a.

en: And the men of Israel said unto the Hivites, Peradventure ye dwell among us; and how shall we make a covenant with you?
hmr: Israelhai ruok chun Hiv mihai kuoma chun, “Keini laia chêng ve hi in lo ni zing el rawi maw; iengtin am in kuomah thu thlung el thei kan ta?” an tih a.

en: And they said unto Joshua, We are thy servants. And Joshua said unto them, Who are ye? and from whence come ye?
hmr: Anni chun Josua kuoma chun, “I siehlawhai kan ni hi,” an ta. Josua chun an kuomah, “Tuhai am in ni leh? Khâwtienga inthawka hung am in ni leh?” a tih a.

en: And they said unto him, From a very far country thy servants are come because of the name of Jehovah thy God: for we have heard the fame of him, and all that he did in Egypt,
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “LALPA i Pathien hming leiin i siehlawhai hi ram hlataka inthawka hung kan nih, a hming inthangzie dâm, Aiguptaa a thilthaw po po dâm,

en: and all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites, that were beyond the Jordan, to Sihon king of Heshbon, and to Og king of Bashan, who was at Ashtaroth.
hmr: Jordan vadung râla Amor mihai lal pahnihai Hesbon ram lal Sihon hai dâm, Basan ram lal Astaroth khuoa um Og hai dâm chunga a thilthaw po pohai kha kan hriet sih a.

en: And our elders and all the inhabitants of our country spake to us, saying, Take provision in your hand for the journey, and go to meet them, and say unto them, We are your servants: and now make ye a covenant with us.
hmr: Chun, kan upahai le kan rama chênghai po po chun kan kuomah, ‘Lampuia dingin fâk dinghai chawiin anni va be ro khai; chun, an kuomah, in siehlawhai kan ni hi, kan kuomah thu thlung ro khai ti unla,’ tiin an hril a.

en: This our bread we took hot for our provision out of our houses on the day we came forth to go unto you; but now, behold, it is dry, and is become mouldy:
hmr: Hieng kan fâk dinga kan beihai hi in kuoma hung dinga kan hung suok niin kan ina inthawka a luma kan hung chawi an na, nisienla- khawm, tuhin chu en hman ta u, a ṭâwl ṭuk tah a, a ap bur ta hi.

en: and these wine-skins, which we filled, were new; and, behold, they are rent: and these our garments and our shoes are become old by reason of the very long journey.
hmr: Hieng uoin peng kan thunnahai khawm hi a thar an na, en hman ta u, an inek vawng ta hi. Hieng kan puonhai le kan kekawkhai khawm hi kan hungna a hla khawp a, an hlui vawng ta hi,” an ta.

en: And the men took of their provision, and asked not counsel at the mouth of Jehovah.
hmr: Israel mihai chun an fâk ding hung chawi chu an lâk a, LALPA bâua thurâwn hrim an indawn nawh a.

en: And Joshua made peace with them, and made a covenant with them, to let them live: and the princes of the congregation sware unto them.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josua chun anni le chun inremna a siem a, anni chu hlâ dingin an inkârah thuthlung a siem tah a, chun, a pungkhâwmhai laia mi lienhai khawm chun an kuomah ṭawng an inkhâm tah a.

en: And it came to pass at the end of three days after they had made a covenant with them, that they heard that they were their neighbors, and that they dwelt among them.
hmr: Chun, an kuoma thu an thlung china inthawka ni thuma chun an khaw kâwlhnai, anni laia lo um ve zing hlakhai an nih ti an hriet suok tah a.

en: And the children of Israel journeyed, and came unto their cities on the third day. Now their cities were Gibeon, and Chephirah, and Beeroth, and Kiriath-jearim.
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai chu an fe pei a, ni thum ni chun an khawpuihai chu an va tlung a. An khawpuihai chu Gibeon dâm, Kephira dâm, Beeroth dâm, Kiriath-Jearim dâm an nih.

en: And the children of Israel smote them not, because the princes of the congregation had sworn unto them by Jehovah, the God of Israel. And all the congregation murmured against the princes.
hmr: Pungkhâwmhai mi lienhai chun LALPA Israelhai Pathien sâla ṭawng an lo inkhâm ta leiin, Israel thlahai chun anni an tâwk nawh a. Chuong- chun, pungkhâwmhai po po chu mi lienhai chunga chun an chier a.

en: But all the princes said unto all the congregation, We have sworn unto them by Jehovah, the God of Israel: now therefore we may not touch them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi lienhai po po chun pungkhâwmhai po po kuoma chun, “LALPA Israelhai Pathien sâlin an kuomah ṭawng kan lo inkhâm ta sih a; chuleiin, anni chu tuhin ei tâwk a thieng naw a nih.

en: This we will do to them, and let them live; lest wrath be upon us, because of the oath which we sware unto them.
hmr: Hieng ang hin an chungah thâwng ei ta, hla el ei tiu, chuong naw chun an kuoma ṭawng kan lo inkhâm ta leiin ei chunga hin lunginsenna hung tlung el a tih,” an tih a.

en: And the princes said unto them, Let them live: so they became hewers of wood and drawers of water unto all the congregation, as the princes had spoken unto them.
hmr: Chun, mi lienhai ma chun an kuomah, “Hlain um el raw hai se,” an tih a. Chuongchun, pungkhâwmhai po po thing inkhâwmtua le tui chawi- tuah an hung um tah a, mi lienhaiin an hril ang chun.

en: And Joshua called for them, and he spake unto them, saying, Wherefore have ye beguiled us, saying, We are very far from you; when ye dwell among us?
hmr: Josua chun anni chu ân kotir a, an kuomah, “Iengdinga, ‘Ram hla- taka inthawka hung kan nih,’ tia in mi hlêm el am? Keini laia chêng ve in lo ni zing el sih a.

en: Now therefore ye are cursed, and there shall never fail to be of you bondmen, both hewers of wood and drawers of water for the house of my God.
hmr: Chuleiin, ṭawngsephur in hung ni a ni ta hi, ieng lai khawmin nangni laia mi ṭhenkhat hi suok ni zing an ta, kan Pathien ta dinga thing inkhâwm- tua le tui chawituah um zing an tih,” tiin a hril a.

en: And they answered Joshua, and said, Because it was certainly told thy servants, how that Jehovah thy God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you; therefore we were sore afraid for our lives because of you, and have done this thing.
hmr: Anni chun Josua chu an dawn a, “LALPA i Pathien a siehlaw Mosie khan ram pumpui hi pe cheua in hmaa a ram hluotu um po pohai hi sukbohmang pei ding a nih ti thu a lo pêk kha i siehlawhai hi an lo hril chieng êm a; chuleiin, nangni leiin kan hringna hi chân kan inlau êm a, hieng ang hin kan lo thaw el a nih.

en: And now, behold, we are in thy hand: as it seemeth good and right unto thee to do unto us, do.
hmr: Tuhin, ngai ta, i kuta um kan na, i ngaia ṭha le indika i hriet ang ang chun kan chunga hin thaw pei el rawh,” an tih a.

en: And so did he unto them, and delivered them out of the hand of the children of Israel, that they slew them not.
hmr: Chuongchun, an chunga chun chuong ang chun a thaw tah a, Israel thlahaia inthawk chun a sansuok a, anni chu an that ta nawh a.

en: And Joshua made them that day hewers of wood and drawers of water for the congregation, and for the altar of Jehovah, unto this day, in the place which he should choose.
hmr: Josua chun chu ni chun LALPA- IN hmun a ruotna taphawtah pung- khâwmhai le LALPA mâichâm ta dinga tulai chena thing inkhâwmtua le tui chawituah a ruot a.
